title: Everyday English Course 111
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text:
M: Good morning. Mary, how's it going?
W: Pretty good, Bill. How about you?
M: Oh. I'm OK. How is that English class you're teaching?
W: It's going really well. I have a great class this year. I've got 30 students.
M: That's good. I love to teach English. I'm only teaching history now.
{a}

variables.a: What subject does the man teach now?

answerOptions: The woman does not need to worry about her study now.
The woman should not worry about her vacation.
instances.correctAnswer: The woman does not need to worry about her study now.

variables.a: What will they do first?

questionTemplates.text:
M: Good morning. I would like to borrow some novels in English. What kind of books would you recommend?
W: It might be a good idea to read some easy articles first. You will enjoy them more and be able to read fast.
M: That's a good idea. Thank you for your advice.
{a}

answerOptions: Read some easy articles in English first.
instances.correctAnswer: Read some easy articles in English first.

questionTemplates.text:
M: Mrs. Huang, you are on the third floor.
W: It looks very comfortable.
M: You have got a lovely view of Yellowstone Park. This is your private room, and just opposite is a kitchen which all six of you share. There is a common room at the end of the corridor, and a game room next door.
{a}

answerOptions: At the end of the corridor.
instances.correctAnswer: At the end of the corridor.
